page.title: 05St.Andrew's Church W.Dean
page.content: St.Andrews Church suffered a terrible fire in 1934,which destroyed most of the woodwork and stone mouldings. Yet by 1936,the Parish had built a new modern church. For nearly 1000 years,the local inhabitants have worshipped at the church.The tower was built in 1726-this date is inscribed on the sundial south of the church.It holds three bells,one from 1601,one from 1651 and one of an uncertain date.All the bells were recast in 1936.The walls are all Saxon,and are good examples of the architectural style of this period. The North Door is sometimes called The Devil's Door because according to local tradition,it allows the Devil to leave a child when he or she is baptised.The church also contains memorials from both the First and Second World War.
